page.title: 01Connor Downs
page.content: Approximately one third of this area is sea. The sand dunes are for ever encroaching upon the Gwithian area. These, the good beaches and surfing encourage tourism and there are several caravan parks. Unfortunatley 'Red River' runs into the sea from the mining area of Redruth/Camborne between the beach and Churchtown Road. Gwithian is a quiet, picturesque village. Whilst Connor Downs has expanded residentially there has been no industrial development and the passing tourist has now been diverted from the old A30 road onto the new bypass to Penzance. Bed and breakfast houses are said to have suffered. The 1981 census shows that Connor Downs has 261 dwellings whilst Gwithian has 299, with an estimated population of 850 which increases in the holiday seasons.
